etymologies: modern Latin, from Greek stegē ‘covering’ + sauros ‘lizard’

definitions: a small-headed quadrupedal herbivorous dinosaur of the Jurassic and early Cretaceous periods, with a double row of large bony plates or spines along the back.

notes.text: Infraorder Stegosauria, order Ornithischia: several genera, including Stegosaurus

shortDefinitions: small-headed quadrupedal herbivorous dinosaur of Jurassic and early Cretaceous periods, with double row of large bony plates or spines
